results.title: Cosi Fan Tutte [Australian Opera]
results.brief_description: Mozart’s classic comedy is performed at the Victorian Arts Centre, March 28, 1990 as part of the ‘Esso night at the opera’ series. Cast includes Yvonne Kenny, David Hobson, Fiona Janes, Jeffrey Black, Rosamund Illing and John Pringle. In Italian with English sub-titles, music conducted by Peter Robinson.

results.title: Cortege of Eagles (TEFC)
results.brief_description: One of a group of modern dances created by Martha Graham. A creative ballet representing her mature creative work. The story is set in Ancient Troy at the time of its fall. When Hecuba, portrayed by Martha Graham, is faced with the inevitable consequence of the violent times, she herself is driven to terrible violence. Music composed and conducted by Eugene Lester: setting by Isamu Noguchi.

results.title: Cork in Portugal
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the economic importance of cork production to Portugal and its people, and describes the role of the cork worker in a changing industry. Examines the way in which cork is harvested, processed and manufactured into a wide variety of products which are used all over the world.

results.title: Coriolanus
results.brief_description: Coriolanus is the name given to an honourable but arrogant patrician, Caius Martius, after capturing the town of Corioli where a plebeian uprising has occurred. He rises to distinction, but through his pride and insincerity does not govern well. He is sent into exile by the Senators after he criticises them harshly in the Forum. Scorned, he joins forces with the uprisers and plans to sack Rome. It is only through the intervention of his wife and his mother that he revokes this decision and enters into a peace treaty with the Senators.

results.title: Cops, spies and private eyes
results.brief_description: Australia’s first television policeman, Terry McDermott, better known as Detective Sergeant Frank Bronson from “Homicide” narrates this documentary on the Australian cop shows which screened on commercial television from 1956-2000. Features footage from both popular long-running and short-lived series. Television shows include: Al Munch (I Found Joe Barton) ; Consider Your Verdict ; Homicide ; Hunter ; Divorce Court ; The Unloved ; Division Four ; The Linkmen ; The Long Arm ; Matlock Police ; Boney ; The Spoiler ; Vendetta ; Ryan ; Silent Number ; Shannon’s Mob ; King’s Men ; Bluey ; Case for the Defence ; Cop Shop ; Bellamy ; Waterloo Station ; Special Squad ; Rafferty’s Rules ; Skirts ; Bony ; The Feds ; Blue Heelers ; Singapore Sling ; Cody ; Halifax FP ; Water Rats ; State Coroner ; Good Guys Bad Guys ; Murder Call ; Stingers and Above the Law.

results.title: Coping with deafness
results.creator_credit: Richard Dobson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Bob, Maree and Sadie have hearing impairment. They have illustrated, by means of their own simple sketches, how deafness has affected their lives and how they cope with their disability. Interviewer: Pat Pengilley.

results.title: Copenhagen holiday [edited version]
results.brief_description: A film whose feature is the Bing and Grohndahl Porcelain Potteries in Copenhagen. Shows the beautiful ceramic figures being made and hand-painted. The sung narration adds an unusual slant to the film. (Note this is an edited version of “Copenhagen holiday”, Title Code 002410).

results.title: Cool creatures : reptiles
results.brief_description: This video examines reptiles, noting their characteristics, major groups, kinds and interesting traits of reptiles, both extinct and in existence today. Reptiles identified and discussed are: turles, lizards, snakes, crocodiles, alligators, gharials and ciamans. Different reptile habitats are explored, along with the reptile’s mechanisms for survival. Suitable for Primary level students.
results.description: This video examines reptiles, noting their characteristics, major groups, kinds and interesting traits of reptiles, both extinct and in existence today. results.title: Cool change
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Dennis Wright and Delatite Productions
results.brief_description: Set in the highlands of Victoria, deals with a bitter struggle between the greenies and the cattlemen. When the government moves to evict a woman who is running more cattle on her property than the law allows, the other cattlemen band together to battle on her behalf.

results.title: Cool Cats: 25 Years of Rock `N` Roll
results.brief_description: Cool Cats traces the evolution of rock-related style, fashion and affectation; from stovepipe trousers, drape jackets and duck’s tail haircuts to bondage straps, androgynous jumpsuits and lethal Mohican scalp spikes. The performances and posturing of the Rolling Stones, Little Richard, Tina Turner, The Beatles, among others, are intertwined with observations from the likes of Pete Townshend, Phil Everly, Malcolm McLaren and Grace Slick. Rating: G
